Articles.Content:
So, I went on EVA with Jeb, then put 4x time warp on.

After that, I installed bandicam to record this.

It looks like he's muttering to himself.

Or having a Gravity-style panic attack, with less panic and more crazy.
Heh, and Bob will absolutely freak out during time warp. It's like their strongest trait becomes the most prominent when warping.

When I see any kerbal doing that, I hear the following in the back of my mind:

"Woooooooohaaaaa! Yeeeeeaaaaaaa! AAAAMAAAAZZIINNNGGG! MOOOORREEE! YEAYEAYEAYEAYEA!!!"

(Repeat ad infinitum)

Especially Jeb seems to be in a continuous adrenaline trip when he's in space.
When I first saw this effect, I instantly thought of the space core, when he was talking quickly.
Heeheeha... it's mine... the space is all mine...
Okay... I had "Eat Sleep Rave Repeat" playing in the background, and his lips synced perfectly.
It looks like he's trying to sing dubstep.
Look at my avatar. Jeb probably also is a evil villain. The picture is NOT photoshopped. I just had an Idle mechjeb too close to the cockpit window.

Look at my avatar. Jeb probably also is a evil villain. The picture is NOT photoshopped. I just had an Idle mechjeb too close to the cockpit window.

There does seem to be some black magic involved when Jeb just appears one day at KSC after being left on a one-way trip to Eeloo. Ten years ago.
